title: Strong Spain leads late bookings
text:
Strong Spain leads late bookings 6 August 2015 Save 
Spain has received a late-booking boost, one OTA has revealed. 
Of the top five destinations to have been booked between June 1 and July 20 for this summer, the first four are Majorca, Tenerife, Lanzarote and Ibiza. 
Dalaman was the only non-Spanish destination to make the top five as Turkey prices plummet, offering deals 15% cheaper than last year. 
Meanwhile, Cyprus has seen the biggest increase in late bookings which have grown 44% since last year. Egypt came second with 22%, Turkey third at 19%, Greece 17% and Spain at 16%. 
Alistair Daly, chief marketing officer at On the Beach, said: “Spain is dominating the late deals market, however other popular destinations such as Cyprus, Egypt and Turkey are proving more popular than last year. For people looking for a great value last minute holiday, Turkey offers the best deals.” 
“Holidaymakers have clearly had enough of the appalling British summer and are jetting off to warmer climes.”
